verses.roman:
eka-dina śivānande ghāṭiyāle rākhila
kukkurake bhāta dite sevaka pāsarilā

synonyms: eka-dina—one day; śivānande—Śivānanda Sena; ghāṭiyāle—tollman; rākhilā—detained; kukkurake—unto the dog; bhāta dite—to supply rice; sevaka—the servant; pāsarilā—forgot.
translation: One day while Śivānanda was detained by a tollman, his servant forgot to give the dog its cooked rice.
